titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Faust Club records 1977.268
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:48:18 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes materials documenting the activities of the Faust Club from 1872 to 1875, including a minute book, correspondence, a directory with lists of members and committees, and an account book with a name index.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Faust Club records, 1977.268, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Faust Club was formed in 1872 as a social club for Brooklyn artists, actors, musicians, and journalists. The Club was located at a house on Remsen Street, but dissolved in 1875 due to depleted finances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes materials documenting the activities of the Faust Club from 1872 to 1875, including a minute book, correspondence, a directory with lists of members and committees, and an account book with a name index.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Daniel B. Thompson, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
